value:
{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.10029v1", "title": "Quantum Squeezing Effects in Coupled van der Pol Oscillators", "summary": "Achieving synchronized quantum states within the quantum realm is a
significant goal. This regime is characterized by restricted excitation
occurrences and a highly nonclassical stable state of the self-oscillating
system. However, many existing approaches to observe synchronization in this
quantum realm face a major challenge: the influence of noise tends to
overshadow the synchronization phenomenon. In coupled van der Pol oscillators,
synchronization occurs when a system of two or more oscillators interacts. Our
investigation demonstrates that introducing the squeezing Hamiltonian in two
coupled van der Pol oscillators enhances nonclassical effects, increases
quantum correlations, and improves the robustness of synchronization dynamics.
This was evidenced through the analysis of the Wigner function and power
spectrum, showing significant improvements compared to systems without
squeezing.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-14T09:33:05Z"}
